main event: Three college professors observed an unidentified object in Potomac, Maryland on July 29, 1963.
interesting points: The object was slightly brighter than stars and extremely slow moving., It had an estimated size of 1.5 to 2 degrees of arc per minute., The observers concluded there was insufficient data to identify the object., The object was described as round in shape and bright yellow-white in color., It was visible for approximately 15 minutes before disappearing.
